cronSchedule.cronScheduleTip: Further info on specific cron values

error.Cannot specify both daysOfMonth and days: 'Day of month' and 'Day of week' are not allowed to use * each. Use a ? (blank value) in either of them.
error.Cannot use blank value in daysOfMonth an: 'Day of month' and 'Day of week' are not allowed to use ? each. Use a * (every day of month or every day of week) in either of them.
error.Expected 5 values, but got 1: Please fill out all input fields for the Cron Schedule.
error.Expected 5 values, but got 2: Please fill out all input fields for the Cron Schedule.
error.Expected 5 values, but got 3: Please fill out all input fields for the Cron Schedule.
error.Expected 5 values, but got 4: Please fill out all input fields for the Cron Schedule.
error.blank notation is not allowed in hours f: Hours field doesn't support ? (blank value). Please use a * (every hour) or a specific value.
error.blank notation is not allowed in minutes: Minutes field doesn't support ? (blank value). Please usa * (every minute) or a specific value.
error.blank notation is not allowed in months: Months field doesn't support ? (blank value). Please use a * (every hour) or a specific value.
error.daysOfMonth field is undefined: Please fill out all input fields for the Cron Schedule.
error.hours field is undefined: Please fill out all input fields for the Cron Schedule.
error.months field is undefined: Please fill out all input fields for the Cron Schedule.

titles.everyMinuteInSetTime: Every minute in the range of xx:00 to xx:10

info.generalInfo: Provide a number, a list of numbers (e.g. 1,2,3) or a range (e.g. 12-14)
info.questionMark: No specific value (e.g. any day of the week)

cronSchedule.limitDescription: This version of the More Cron Scheduler only supports whole numbers, * or ?. Expressions like 0/1 or 3-20 are not supported for the time being.
cronSchedule.quickStart: or use Cronhub to get quickly started.
cronSchedule.quickStartNote: Seconds and years are handled automatically.

dataDownload.description: Here you can download the study data based on various filters.

label.chooseObservationDesc: Choose an existing observation to link to.
label.description: An integration enables to link an external API to an existing observation. Choose the observation for which you want to create a token to link the observation to your external device.

msg.createdToken: Please copy your token to be able to link. The token won't be reviewable afterwards, so be mindful with your usage. If you loose a token you can recreate it at anytime.
msg.delete: An deleted integration can't be restored again. Are you sure you want to delete the integration?

placeholder.tokenLabelInput: Please enter a label for your token.

error.addTokenLabel: Please add a label for your token
error.selectObservation: Please select an observation you want to link to.

dialog.description: Enter your intervention's base information and configuration. Add the trigger configuration and at least one action to continue.

label.triggerConditionsDesc: Configure trigger properties from observations or observation types. To compare the property values use <, >, >=, <=, = or != (is not).

pushNotification.description: Sends a push notification to all matching participants based on the trigger.
pushNotification.title: Push Notification Action

observation.description: Select an existing observation (currently simple questions and lime surveys are supported)
observation.name: Observation

configProps.hourDesc: The hour of the given day

relativeTime.description: Triggers an action on a given relative time (day and hour-of-day)
relativeTime.title: Relative Time Trigger

configProps.cronDesc: Triggers and action based on a set cron trigger.Show further info on possible cron values.

scheduled.description: This trigger triggers and action based on a cron trigger.
scheduled.title: Scheduled Trigger

configProps.onlyOnceDesc: Triggers only once when value is matching; resets when value is not matching anymore
configProps.queryDesc: The query for values in simple query syntax..
configProps.queryObjDesc: A more complex variant of query
configProps.timeWindowName: Time window in seconds from the query time

scheduledDatacheck.description: This trigger triggers an action based on a cron trigger and specific observation data capture values.

interventionList.description: An intervention describes an action delivered to the app triggered by a scheduled interval or by rules on captured data.

interventionList.title: Interventions

placeholder.emptyScheduler: Please provide a schedule for your intervention

avgHeartRate.description: Compares the average heart rate of all participants over time, with a time interval of 1 minute.
avgHeartRate.label: Heart rate
avgHeartRate.title: Average heart rate per participant over time

responseDistribution.description: Each segment represents the frequency of a particular answer and shows how many participants selected the respective option.
responseDistribution.label: All Responses
responseDistribution.title: Distribution of Participant Responses

responseDistributionResponse.description: Each column in the bar chart represents the number of responses per study group.
responseDistributionResponse.label: Groups by Response
responseDistributionResponse.title: Response Distribution Across Study Groups

responseDistributionStudyGroup.description: Each column in the bar chart represents the number of responses per study group.
responseDistributionStudyGroup.label: Responses by Group
responseDistributionStudyGroup.title: Response Distribution Across Study Groups

dataList.description: The most recently collected data points are displayed here in tabular form and the entire data points can be displayed in various visualizations.
dataList.emptyListMsg: Currently there are no observations to track.
dataList.title: Recorded observations

dataPointsList.filterInfo: Filtering is only possible for visualization.

monitoring.description: You can view the live data of your study here. Data will be updated every {duration} seconds.

msg.delete: Deletion of an observation can’t be revoked! Are you sure you want to delete following observation:
msg.hiddenInfo: If an observation is hidden, it will start in the background as long as the participant is logged in. An automatic started observation isn't shown on the normal schedule view in the app.

error.addParticipantInfo: The participant information describes the purpose of the observation. Please enter a participant information.

error.addTitle: The observation title is required. Please enter a title.

accelerometerMobile.title: Accelerometer Mobile Sensor

external.description: An observation for data that is collected via the external data api.
external.title: External Observation

gpsMobile.description: This observation enables you to collect GPS data via the smartphone sensor.
gpsMobile.title: GPS Mobile Sensor

limeSurvey.description: This observation enables you to link a Lime Survey questionnaire created on the More Platform with its ID. Use the Lime Survey. Remember to check within Lime Survey that your survey allows for "multiple responses or update responses with one access code", and that your survey is active.
limeSurvey.title: Lime Survey

polarVerity.description: This observation enables you to collect heart rate data via the polar verity sensor.
polarVerity.title: Polar Verity Sensor

configProps.questionDesc: The question you want to ask.

simpleQuestion.description: This observation enables you to create a simple multiple choice question.
simpleQuestion.title: Simple Question

observationList.description: An observation can be sensor data from a mobile phone, a wearable device or information gathered from a questionnaire. An observation can be assigned to one specific study group. If no study group is assigned, the observation will be applied to the entire study.
observationList.emptyListMsg: Add and manage your studies observations
observationList.title: Observations

placeholder.emptySchedulerMsg: Please provide a schedule for your observation.
placeholder.enterMainPurpose: Enter the main purpose and intention of the study.

deleteMsg.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this participant?
deleteMsg.intro: You are about to delete the following participant:
deleteMsg.warning: A deleted participant can't be restored. You have the option to delete a participant including all the collected data or the participant alone.

header.distribute: Distribute participants randomly to study groups

msg.delete: Do you really want to delete this participant?
msg.deleteWithData: Include all data for the participant?

participantsList.description: Add participants manually or by importing a list with alias names. Participants can be automatically assigned to groups and exported to a CSV.

distributeMsg.confirm: Distribution of participants can't be revoked. Are you sure you want to assign the participants to your study groups?
distributeMsg.intro: You are about to distribute all participants to your study groups.
distributeMsg.warning: Participants will be randomly assigned to the created study groups. They are evenly seperated to the groups. Reassigning participants will assign all participants randomly to your groups again.

participantsList.emptyListMsg: Add study participants to your study
participantsList.title: Participants

absoluteSchedule.description: An absolute Schedule includes absolute date times. Observations can be timed by absolute dates and timeframes.

dialog.description: An absolute Schedule includes absolute date times. A relativ schedule collects data based on participant login and individual study starts.
dialog.noSetScheduleDesc: If there is no schedule set, the whole schedule time will be set als default time as absolute Schedule.

relativeSchedule.dayExplanation: The term 'Day' signifies the correlation between the start of an individual participant's study and the corresponding day value. (Example: Participant logs in on {egLoginDate}, study start is set to Day 2. They start on {egStartDate}.)
relativeSchedule.description: A relative schedule is determined by each participant's actual log-in time. They can start anytime between the study's beginning and end, and the set duration covers their active participation period.

error.cannotRepeat: The observation cannot occur again as it would exceed the end of the study.

dtend.EndBeforeStart: Please Set the relative start period before the end period
dtend.addOffset: Fill in the offset of the relative end period.

dtstart.addOffset: Fill in the offset of the relative start period.

rrrule.endAfter: Fill in the offset to the end date.
rrrule.repetitionEndTooLong: The end of repetitions must not exceed the remaining study duration of {durValue} {durUnit}.
rrrule.repetitionTooLong: Repetitions must not exceed the end of the study. The maximum interval is {repValue} {repUnit}.

error.scheduleTooLong: The observation must not exceed the study period of {maxDuration} days.
error.startTimeBeforeEnd: Start time must be before the end time.

relativeSchedule.interventionWarning: Note that setting an absolute date (setting day or month) via cron scheduler might not be that effective when working with relative observation schedules. Relative observation schedules will be calculated based on the individual study start of participants (log in).

rrrule.endsAfter: Ends 0 days after individual study start | Ends 1 day after individual study start | Ends {n} days after individual study start

dialog.repeatEventDescription: The event above will be repeated after the runtime of the current event has finished.

info.dateOverlapEnd: Start date was resetted to end date. Please be sure to set start and end time within each others range.
info.dateOverlapStart: End date was changed with start date. Please be sure to set start and end time within each others range.
info.endDateNotWithinRange: End date was not inside the study range. Please be sure to set the dates inside the study ranges.
info.startDateNotWithinRange: Start date was not inside the study range. Please be sure to set the dates inside the study ranges.
info.timeOutsideStudyRange: Please be sure to set start and end time within the study range.
info.timeOverlapEnd: Start time was changed with end time. Please be sure to set start and end time within each others range.
info.timeOverlapStart: End time was changed with start time. Please be sure to set start and end time within each others range.

titles.fullTimespan: Continuous data collection over the entire two-month period
titles.series: Repeat single day schedule for 10 days

values.fullTimespan:
Uncheck 'One day observation' • Start: {egStartDate}, 08:00 - End: {egEndDate}, 20:00
Optional: Check 'Entire day'
values.series:
Check 'One day observation' • Timeframe: {egDate}, 14:00 - 16:00
Repeat: Daily - After 10 days

event.repeatDesc: To repeat the set duration above, you can schedule it up to a specific amount of days or weeks. Consider, that the whole timeframe above will be repeated.
event.setDatesDesc: You can define a timeframe for your observation with start and end date for one day. The timeframe can be set to 'Entire day'. A series of data collection can be defined through the repetition definition below. Alternatively you can set a full time span over more days.

warningsAndErrors.endWasChangedWithStartValue: End value was changed with start value.
warningsAndErrors.rruleEndIsEmpty: Please set and end point for your repetition period.
warningsAndErrors.rruleFreqIsEmpty: Please set the frequency for your repetition.
warningsAndErrors.rruleWeeklyIsMissingByDay: Please set the weekdays for your repetition.

deleteMsg.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete your study?
deleteMsg.intro: You are about to delete the following study:
deleteMsg.warning: A deleted study can't be restored. If you delete this study you won't be able to use it at a later date. It is only possible to delete a study without its data for the time being.

description.consentInfo: The consent information will be displayed in the app and has to be approved by the participants.
description.contactData: This contact information will be displayed in the app for participants to use when they encounter problems.
description.duration: The study duration is the period when participants are actively contributing to data collection. This is important when using relative observations. If no study duration is specified, the entire time from study start to end of the study is considered.
description.durationExample: Study Start; {egStartDate} - Study End: {egEndDate} (5 months) - Study Duration: 4 weeks. The participant's active participation time for the study is limited to 4 weeks, determined by their login date.
description.participantInfo: The participant information will be displayed on the app as the studies description. It should give a short information about the study and its purpose. It also includes the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy of the organization conducting the study.
description.purpose: The purpose property describes the general purpose of the study. This information will only be shown to study collaborators on the study configurator.
description.study: Enter the base information of your study to provide basic information for collaborators and participants.

error.missedFieldsMsg: Please fill out the following information fields:

msg.delete: A deleted study can't be restored. Are you sure you want to delete your study?
msg.urlCopied: Link to study '{title} (Id: {studyId})'  was copied to your clipboard.

error.addConsentInfo: The consent information is required. Please enter a description.
error.addContactEmail: Please add a contact email address, which participants can use to contact your institute when they encounter problems.
error.addContactInfo: Please add a contact person and email address, which participants can use to contact your institute when they encounter problems.
error.addContactPerson: Please add a contact person, which participants can write to when they encounter problems.
error.addContactTel: Please add a valid contact telephone number, which participants can use to contact your institute when they encounter problems.
error.addDuration: Please enter both a duration and a unit.
error.addParticipantInfo: The participant information is required. Please enter a description.
error.addTitle: The study title is required. Please enter a study title.
error.durationSmallerThanStudySpan: The specified duration must not exceed {maxDuration} day(s).

ical.copyMsg: Link for ICalendar subscription ('{title} (Id: {studyId})') was copied to clipboard.
ical.title: Calendar for subscription

placeholder.consentInfoInput: Please provide information on the data that will be collected. This description will be shown on the participant's app.
placeholder.contactPerson: Enter the information of the contact person.
placeholder.durationInput: Please provide the duration of the study
placeholder.emptyConsentInfo: Enter your description for the consent information.
placeholder.emptyParticipantInfo: The participant information hasn't been added yet.
placeholder.emptyPurpose: The purpose information hasn't been added yet.
placeholder.finishText: Enter an ending information that will be displayed in the app when the study is completed.
placeholder.finishTextDesc: The ending information will be displayed in the App after a study was completed. Is no specific ending information set a default message will be displayed.
placeholder.institute: Enter the institute of your study.
placeholder.missingContactData: Currently there is no contact information set. Please set at least a contact person and email address, that participants can contact when they encounter problems. This information will be shown on the app.
placeholder.participantInfoInput: Please provide information for your studies participants. This description will be visible on the participant's app.
placeholder.purposeInput: Please provide a short description of your research purpose for your collaborators.

active-closed.confirm: This study status change cannot be reversed and the study will stay 'COMPLETED'. Are you sure you want to set your study status to 'COMPLETED'?
active-closed.intro: You are about to change your study status to 'COMPLETED'.
active-closed.warning: Changing your study status to 'COMPLETED' will set all data capture, intervention rules and schedules to finished and no data will be captured anymore. The participants won't be able to participate in a completed study anymore.

active-paused.confirm: Are you sure you want to set your Study Status to 'PAUSED'?
active-paused.intro: You are about to change your study status to 'PAUSED'.
active-paused.warning: Changing your study status to 'PAUSED' will result into pausing all observations, interventions and data captures for the time being. The participant app won't be collecting data until the study is set back to 'ACTIVE'.

draft-active.confirm: This study status change cannot be reversed, but there is the possibility to pause the study to make changes to your settings. Are you sure you want to set your Study Status to 'ACTIVE'?
draft-active.intro: You are about to change your study status to 'ACTIVE'.
draft-active.warning: Changing your study status to 'ACTIVE', will make the study available to your participants in the app and set all your interventions and observations into data capture mode, based on their set schedule. Participants will be able to log in and participate in the research. If the planned start date is after today's date, it will be set to the actual start date with this status change.

draft-preview.intro: You are about to start a study 'PREVIEW'
draft-preview.warning: All data recorded during the preview will be discarded once you complete the preview.

paused-active.confirm: Are you sure you want to set your Study Status to 'ACTIVE'
paused-active.warning: All observations, interventions, schedules and data captures will be available again. The participants will be able to continue their participation on the app.

paused-preview-preview.intro: You are about to resume your preview
paused-preview-preview.warning: All observations, interventions, schedules and data captures will be available again. The participants will be able to continue their participation on the app.

preview-draft.intro: You are about to end the study 'PREVIEW'
preview-draft.warning: All data recorded so far will be deleted, all participants will be re-initialized.

preview-paused-preview.intro: You are about to 'PAUSE' your preview
preview-paused-preview.warning: Changing your study status to 'PAUSED' will result into pausing all observations, interventions and data captures for the time being. The participant app won't be collecting data until the preview is resumed.

studyList.description: This is a list of your studies, the studies that you created or that you were invited to as a collaborator.

error.studyImportFailed: The study {filename} could not be imported

studyList.title: My dashboard of studies

collaboratorList.description: Study collaborators can be provided with one or more roles. A Study Administrator has no limitation. A Study Operator is allowed to manage and view information, but is not allowed to view recorded data. A Study Viewer can only view the basic overview information and recorded data.
collaboratorList.title: Study collaborators

dialog.addCollaboratorInfo: will be added to your collaborator list.
dialog.addRole: Please choose at least one role to continue.

deleteMsg.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this study collaborator?

deleteMsg.warning: A deleted study collaborator can be added again on a later date. If deleted he will loose his permission to edit or view this study.

msg.delete: Do you really want to delete the collaborator?

deleteMsg.warning: A deleted study group can't be restored. All information and settings of the study group will be lost. The linked participants, interventions and observations will loose their group link and then apply to the entire study.

msg.delete: Do you really want to delete this study group?

timeline.relativeDateInfo: This simulates the point in time when a participant enters the study.

welcomeMessage: Dear {userName} ({userInstitution}), welcome to your Dashboard of the MORE project. Start by creating a new study or managing existing studies you have been assigned to collaborate on.
